title: Calories in Sea Bass
meta_description: Learn calories in sea bass per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Cooked (baked or grilled), skinless fillet, no added oil, butter, or seasonings; European sea bass variety.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by species, freshness, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked sea bass provides ~97 kcal and ~21g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add lemon butter sauce (1 tsp per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in sea bass per 100g?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for cooked sea bass per 100g.

faqs.q: Is sea bass high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~21g protein per 100g, making it a lean protein source.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked sea bass.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in sea bass?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps it low-cal; frying adds ~40+ kcal from oil.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in sea bass?
faqs.a: Low at 1.7g total fat per 100g, with 0.4g saturated.
